channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CAMEL-22103] camel-cxf: CXF RS Rest service with optional query parameter fails
item.description:
Whilst testing the fix for CAMEL-21912 we came across a regression where the CXF RS service doesn't seem to be able to handle an optional query parameter.

An attempt to invoke the service handler fails with:

org.apache.camel.CamelExecutionException: Exception occurred during execution on the exchange: Exchange[1318A61670C6512-0000000000000000]

        ... 57 common frames omitted

A full reproducer test case is available from: https://github.com/driseley/cxf-arrayconverter-test

The summary of the tests is that in 4.10.3, both the following tests pass:

        // Call the echo CXF Rest service
        Exchange responseExchange = producerTemplate.send("http://localhost:8001/echo?say=hello", e -> {});
        assertNull(responseExchange.getException());
        assertEquals(200, responseExchange.getMessage().getHeader(Exchange.HTTP_RESPONSE_CODE, Integer.class));

        // This is the expected output - the value of the say query paramater
        assertEquals("hello", responseExchange.getMessage().getBody(String.class));

        // Call the echo CXF Rest service
        Exchange responseExchange = producerTemplate.send("http://localhost:8001/echo", e -> {});
        assertNull(responseExchange.getException());
        assertEquals(200, responseExchange.getMessage().getHeader(Exchange.HTTP_RESPONSE_CODE, Integer.class));

        // This is the expected output - the value of the say query parameter - which is null
        assertEquals("null", responseExchange.getMessage().getBody(String.class));

but in 4.10.4, the second test fails with a HTTP/500 and the stacktrace above
item.summary: camel-cxf: CXF RS Rest service with optional query parameter fails

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Do you have a reproducer or something that better can be used to try this.
Sorry - just updated the ticket, yes , here: https://github.com/driseley/cxf-arrayconverter-test
The string value with "null" can not be expected that is wrong. We cannot just blindy convert a CXF MessageContentList to a "null" string just because the array is empty.

I was just demonstrating the existing behaviour with 4.10.3.  

In my example, the interface and implementation for the rest service are as follows:

    private interface EchoService {
        @GET
        @Path("/")
        @Produces(MediaType.TEXT_PLAIN)
        public Response echo(@QueryParam("say") String say);
    }

    private static class EchoServiceImpl implements EchoService {
        @Override
        public Response echo(String say) {
            return Response.ok().entity(say).build();
        }
    }

If the service is called without the "say" query parameter, I think it is reasonable that the "say" parameter in the implementation should be null.

Also - surely the converter shouldn't be throwing a class cast exception?
Thanks for the reproducer, yeah camel-cxf converts that null into a "null" response, but we need to add a check for that optional value in the converter.
